name: nps-focus-digital-library-and-research-station
notes: Scope: National.  NPS Focus Digital Library and Research Station information system manages images and archives of images as well as documents described by linked metadata and provides cross-repository searching of library catalogs within and external to the NPS.  The NPS Focus system is composed of two separate but integrated subsystems: * The NPS Focus Digital Library is a digital resource metadata and file management system. It can be used to store images and documents for search and display through the NPS Focus GUI or as a web service to other systems. * NPS Focus Research Station provides a portal to search across numerous NPS systems including its own digital library of images and documents.

extras.value: This is an ongoing, accumulative information system covering time intervals for 390+ parks and the NPS itself.
National Park Service system-wide which includes all of U.S. and affiliated sites worldwide.
